original: Lagerfelt, Israel Christian Gustaf, friherre, godsägare, Lagerlunda, Malmslätt, f. 18/9/74 i Kärna, Östergötl. 1., av kab :kammarh., frih. Gustaf L. o. Hedvig Lovén. G. 05 m. grev:an Malla Wachtmeister. Barn: Gustaf f. 05, kapt., Ebba 07, d. 36, Hedvig 12, g. m. dipl:ing. R. Wikander, Djursholm, Fredrika (Dicken) 14, Israel 17, d. 45. — Stud:ex. 93, fil. kand. 99, hospit. v. Alnarps lantbr :inst. 00-01. Förvalt. å Lagerlunda 01-13, ägde o. bruk. denna egend. 13-44. Led. av riksd. andra kamm. 09-11, av första kamm. 30-43, led. av landstinget 27-42, led. av styr. f. Östgöta hypoteks-fören. 19-47, ordf. 30-47, ordf. i styr. f. Sv. landskOimm. förb. 39-46, ordf. i kyrkofullm. sed. 43, komm:nd 05-17, komm:stämma sed. 05 o. vägstyr. 07-14, v. ordf. i hush:säll:s’k. 29-44, hed[-led. där sed. 44, led. av kyrkoråd sed. 07, allm. kyrkomötet 25, 26, 29, 32, 34, 36, 38 o, 41, Linköp. domkap. 37-41 o. stiftsrådet, v. ordf. 36-37, mångårig led. av länets prövn:nd m. m. KVOlkl, RNO, Hush:säHsk. GM, PatrstGM, ProPatrstGM, LLA.
translated: Lagerfelt, Israel Christian Gustaf, Baron, landowner, Lagerlunda, Malmslätt, b. 18/9/74 in Kärna, Östergötland. Son of chamberlain Gustaf L. and Hedvig Lovén. Married in 1905 to Countess Malla Wachtmeister. Children: Gustaf, b. 1905, Captain. Ebba, b. 1907, d. 1936. Hedvig, b. 1912, married to engineer R. Wikander, Djursholm. Fredrika (Dicken), b. 1914. Israel, b. 1917, d. 1945. Completed secondary school in 1893. Bachelor of Arts in 1899. Trained at Alnarp Agricultural Institute in 1900-1901. Managed Lagerlunda from 1901-1913, owned and operated the property from 1913-1944. Member of the Second Chamber of the Parliament from 1909-1911, and the First Chamber from 1930-1943. Member of the County Council from 1927-1942. Member and Chairman of the Board of Östergötland Mortgage Association from 1919-1947. Chairman of the Board of the Swedish County Governors' Association from 1939-1946. Chairman of the Church Council since 1943. Commissioner from 1905-1917, Commissioner Assembly since 1905, and Vice Chairman of the Road Board from 1907-1914. Vice Chairman of the National Household Knowledge Association from 1929-1944, honorary member since 1944. Member of the Church Council since 1907, General Church Assembly in 1925, 1926, 1929, 1932, 1934, 1936, 1938, 1941. Member of the Linköping Cathedral Chapter from 1937-1941, and the Diocesan Council, Vice Chairman from 1936-1937. Long-time member of the County Board of Examiners, etc. Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa (KVO). Knight of the Order of the North Star (RNO). Knight of the Swedish Household Order of Knights (Hush:säHsk. GM). Knight of the Patriotic Society (PatrstGM). Pro Patria Gold Medal (ProPatrstGM). Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Letters, History, and Antiquities (LLA).

awards.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Letters, History, and Antiquities
